Key: (It's lunch time...)

(Maria listened to the rest of the lecture
quietly, and the morning faded into noon
like a fog.)
Shido! Time for luncheon.

Yeah, you're right. Now that I think about
it, though...

(Because I didn't make breakfast today,
I also didn't prepare myself a bento for
lunch!)
What is the matter, Shido?
Sorry, Tohka... There's no bento for today.

I-Is that so? Could that be because of the
virtual world we are currently inside of?

That might have something to do with it,
but... Well, it's a long story.

No. Wait a sec. Hey, Maria. You didn't happen
to make a bento, did you?

Unfortunately, all I made was breakfast.
I did not prepare any bento.

I figured as much. It didn't seem like you packed
any bento.

If we have no bento, then I have a proposal.
What if we were to visit the school store today?

Ohh, the school store! If that's the case, I
wish to eat kinako bread, but it's hard to
resist yakisoba bread or coronets. Hmm...

You're so naïve, Tohka Yatogami. You don't know
how much demand there is for kinako bread.
It sells out in no time. The battle has begun.
Wha?! That's not fair, Origami Tobiichi!
Good grief...
Hee hee. Such a noisy bunch.
Kurumi, are you not going over too?

Yes. Please don't worry for my sake. There
is no reason to rush myself.
Gotcha. Then Maria, we'd better...
No. There is no need.
Huh?
There aren't... many people, surprisingly.
Heeey, Onii-chan!
Kotori. You changed your ribbons.

What are you talking about? This is what
I normally wear to school.

(Hm? Right. Duh. There's no need for her to
act like a commander when she's at school.)
Oh. You came to the school store too, darling?

Yeah, just today. This is your and Kotori's first
time here, isn't it?

That's right. My first time, but it's not as busy
as I have been led to believe it is.
No. It's usually way more crowded than this.

Heh. It seems they were intimidated by the
presence of we Yamais, scattering elsewhere.
I doubt that's why...

Question. Why is the canteen so empty?
Though I cannot complain, for we were
able to purchase bread easily.

Shido, the cafeteria was empty. I bought enough
bread for you, so hurry up and eat.

I bought bread for Shido. He should eat mine
instead of whatever you bought, Tohka Yatogami.
Shido-san, um...
OH! I just thought of somethin' good!\nBefore Shido-kun eats the bread, you should\nput it in your clothes to warm it up for him.

You're here too, Yoshino. Which means, wait?
The only people here are ones who aren't
NPCs.

It's unusual that no one else is here. Maybe
it's a system error of some kind?
If that's the case, then Maria would... Hmm?

(Glancing over, I see Maria walking up,
clutching loaves of bread in both arms.)

I have purchased bread from the school store.
This rabbit-shaped bread is interesting.
Ooh. Those rabbit ones are a good choice.
This part, with the red eyes, is unusual.
Those are cherries, Arusu-san.
I see. The fruit of a prunus avium tree.
Wait a moment, Maria.
What is the matter?

You mentioned before that we didn't need to
rush. You didn't... ward everyone away from the
store, did you?
Just enough... so that we would not be troubled.
So you did!
Yes. Otherwise, we would miss our lunches.

Well, that might be true, but didn't you say
this morning that you'd keep life as normal
as possible?
I believe it is no different than usual.
I guess that makes sense... Or does it?

Either way, no harm has been done.
Does this not qualify as normal"?"
It's complicated.

Oh, it might be related to Arusu-san's quest to
find love. I believe there is some correlation
between love and hunger.
I don't know if I believe that.
It's fine, isn't it, darling? Meals are important.
That's true. Then, everything's okay.
That is fine.
No, it's not!
But you just said it was okay...

Err. Well, I did, but when we don't have any
reason to be at the school store, then make
sure you make everything normal again.
Yes. That is what I intended.

(Maria seems to have become more thoughtful,
or maybe craftier? Either way, she's changed
a bit.)

(Hm? Has she started to change...? It's almost
like I've been watching over Maria's progress.
Why did I think of it that way?)

(After all was said and done, we finished lunch.
While it's hard to say afternoon classes went on
without incident, it was a pretty typical day.)

Whew. Classes are over. It was a lot noisier
than usual.

But it was fun. Seems like you're getting
the hang of going to school, Maria.
Shido, with this, school is over, correct?

Yeah, and there are no clubs at our school.
It was a typical day, so maybe it wasn't that
interesting for you.

No, today was interesting. But...
It was not enough.
Not enough? What wasn't enough?
Love.
It's true there wasn't much of that.

In order to learn about love, is it not necessary
for me to take one further step?
One further step?

Shido, please answer honestly. And then,
can you show me?
Show you... what?

If you were to spend special time with
another... would you and that other person
be drawn to one another in the same way?
What are you saying?
If you had to... would you choose me?
Maria...?

Please choose, Shido. Will you teach me
the ways of love?
I... Let's see...

(If that's what Maria wants, and given that I
want to know about Maria, then my answer
is...)
